intro: Phaca artipes, commonly known as the spiky burr plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces spiny, ball-like fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind or animals. Its leaves are typically narrow and hairy, adapting to arid environments. Phaca artipes is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
